bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, August 24, 1945

div1.p: Ireland thanks Hench for the book on the Mayos and explains how much he has enjoyed his association with Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, August 24, 1945
div1.opener:
Answered
Please return
1870 Wyoming Ave.,
Washington 9, D.C.,
August 24, 1945
Colonel Philip Hench, M.C.,
Army and Navy General Hospital,
Hot Springs, Ark.
My dear Colonel Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for a copy of “The Doctor Mayos” which
I appreciate more than I can tell you. You know I have been fortu-
nate in many of my friends and both of the Mayos, particularly Will
Mayo, were my warm personal friends. Reviewing the history of those people
would be like reviewing a history of the Northwest for they certainly
were mixed up in the development. I shall read the book with a great deal
of interest. They were wonderful men and both of them lived to see the
dream of the development of the Foundation come true.

One of the nice things this war has done for me, an old broken
down chap of a former generation, was to bring about my association with
you which I have enjoyed so much and meeting Mrs. Hench was a source of
great pleasure to Mrs. Ireland and myself. I hope the entire family is
well and I hope you are enjoying your work at the hospital and are pick-
ing up a lot of information that will be of value to you.

We have been in Washington all summer and so far as I know will
be here the rest of the year with the exception of some little trips
that we may take now that we can drive into the gas station and tell them
to “fill 'er up”. I hope you will be coming up this way again before so
very long.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, M. W. Ireland *ML
